events.body: Concept ACK. This was added in b9971ae5853c1d62e09d976a8 and 9b009fae6e2, pinging @promag for confirmation on desired meaning.

Concept ACK.
Note that the string change for both the wallet and the functional test should ideally happen in the same commit (i.e. the commit should be squashed), otherwise we have a state in-between where the test would fail.
This might break someone's code right?

Concept ACK

Welcome as a contributor @kootoopas!

> This might break someone's code right?

We should be explicit in that error messages are not an interface. If you need to distinguish between errors programmatically they should have a distinct error code. I did this in #20964, for example.

Edit: speaking of which Is "wallet already loading" close enough to "wallet already loaded" to share the same error code?

> Is "wallet already loading" close enough to "wallet already loaded" to share the same error code?

Good point. Wallets can sometimes take a while to load, so I'm not sure.

verification.payload:
tree aab70e10c5a5f35f65ec4a03fc6ceb82946870fa
parent ea96e17e1f2c2b0a949366260906ef02e560a425
author Fotis Koutoupas <fotis.koutoupas@gmail.com> 1612390751 +0200
committer Fotis Koutoupas <fotis.koutoupas@gmail.com> 1612390751 +0200

wallet: Fix already-loading error message grammar

events.message: wallet: Fix already-loading error message grammar

events.body:
...loaded is past tense - which should indicate that the wallet was not corrupted and loaded successfully - from a debugging perspective.

...loading is present tense - if there is an issue in this stage - we can't eliminate the possibility that the wallet isn't corrupted. 

In a troubleshooting decision tree - "loaded" assumes the wallet is valid - "loading" doesn't assume the wallet is valid. There should be a distinction in logging.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21040/commits/ae9d26a8f0435e2f4b39ad1181473e6575ac67b5 

Will be similar to `Bitcoin Core is probably already running` 
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/63952f73b3041468fe3b25fa54858db7899273fa/src/init.cpp#L1230

comments.body:
"Wallet already loading" seems simplest

```suggestion
        error = Untranslated("Wallet already loading");
```

"being loaded" is more precise since "loading" implies that the wallet is acting instead of being acted on, or at least it introduces the possibility of it acting. So probably "Wallet already being loaded" is the best fit.
I tend to agree with @jonatack here. Shorter (and more *direct*) is better for error messages.
